flawed_nl_solution:
The flashlight was 1/5 of the price of the hoodie, so 80 * 1/5 = $<<80*1/5=16>>16.
The promotion for a pair of boots was 110 * 1/10 = $<<110*1/10=11>>11.
So the pair of boots cost 110 - 11 = $<<110-11=104>>104.
Celina therefore spent 80 + 16 + 104 = $<<80+16+104=200>>200 on the equipment.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 99, not 104. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
